intro: Clyperia, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features small, pale green leaves with a silvery underside, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Clyperia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
